title: JSON RPC calls flooding logs
body:
I am wanting to experiment with nodes other than geth. I setup a nethermind node on my server and it synced quickly and seemed to be working very well. However, when I try to run `brownie test` against it, it gets back invalid data for `eth_getcode` and then I get a HUGE amount of errors that do not stop even though `ganache-cli` and `brownie` have both stopped.


Restarting the server ends the errors. They do not re-appear until I try to run brownie commands again.

I am connecting with websockets. I think maybe nethermind isn't seeing the client disconnect and so is trying to send the message over and over. That's just a guess though.

Let me know if you need more information or more logs. I can try not using websockets for some of this, but not all of it.
@WyseNynja it may be that I broke the websockets code recently and it is relooping the same request - me or @matilote will try to test it tomorrow or so with brownie or truffle on websockets
@WyseNynja we have some delay here but should be able to test it soon.
still pending, sorry, but it is bubbling up the priority list
@WyseNynja fixed and will prepare release soon, sorry it took so long
